author: Robert F. Turner
title: Gina Haspel Followed Faulty Advice in Good Faith
text:
I was outraged when I learned in 2005 that the Central Intelligence Agency had engaged in “enhanced interrogation techniques,” and I spoke against it publicly on several occasions. But I am also outraged at the suggestion by some senators that Gina Haspel’s nomination to lead the CIA should be blocked because she played a role in the implementation of the enhanced-interrogation program.
Ms. Haspel is not an attorney, and she had every reason to rely in good faith on the legal memoranda produced by the Justice Department’s...
